segment.source: Accessing HomeGroup content
segment.target: Accessing HomeGroup content

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: ** Important APIs **
segment.target: ** Important APIs **

segment.source: Windows.Storage.KnownFolders class
segment.target: Windows.Storage.KnownFolders class

segment.source: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.
segment.target: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
segment.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

segment.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.
segment.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic.

segment.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.
segment.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see Asynchronous programming in C++.

segment.source: App capabilty declarations
segment.target: App capabilty declarations

segment.source: To access HomeGroup content, the user's machine must have a HomeGroup set up and your app must have at least one of the following capabilities: picturesLibrary, musicLibrary, or videosLibrary.
segment.target: To access HomeGroup content, the user's machine must have a HomeGroup set up and your app must have at least one of the following capabilities: picturesLibrary, musicLibrary, or videosLibrary.

segment.source: When your app accesses the HomeGroup folder, it will see only the libraries that correspond to the capabilities declared in your app's manifest.
segment.target: When your app accesses the HomeGroup folder, it will see only the libraries that correspond to the capabilities declared in your app's manifest.

segment.source: To learn more, see File access permissions.
segment.target: To learn more, see File access permissions.

segment.source: Note Content in the Documents library of a HomeGroup isn't visible to your app regardless of the capabilities declared in your app's manifest and regardless of the user's sharing settings.
segment.target: Note Content in the Documents library of a HomeGroup isn't visible to your app regardless of the capabilities declared in your app's manifest and regardless of the user's sharing settings.

segment.source: Understand how to use file pickers
segment.target: Understand how to use file pickers

segment.source: You typically use the file picker to access files and folders in the HomeGroup.
segment.target: You typically use the file picker to access files and folders in the HomeGroup.

segment.source: To learn how to use the file picker, see Open files and folders with a picker.
segment.target: To learn how to use the file picker, see Open files and folders with a picker.

segment.source: Understand file and folder queries
segment.target: Understand file and folder queries

segment.source: You can use queries to enumerate files and folders in the HomeGroup.
segment.target: You can use queries to enumerate files and folders in the HomeGroup.

segment.source: To learn about file and folder queries, see Enumerating and querying files and folders.
segment.target: To learn about file and folder queries, see Enumerating and querying files and folders.

segment.source: Open the file picker at the HomeGroup
segment.target: Open the file picker at the HomeGroup

segment.source: Follow these steps to open an instance of the file picker that lets the user pick files and folders from the HomeGroup:
segment.target: Follow these steps to open an instance of the file picker that lets the user pick files and folders from the HomeGroup:

segment.source: Create and customize the file picker
segment.target: Create and customize the file picker

segment.source: Use FileOpenPicker to create the file picker, and then set the picker's SuggestedStartLocation to PickerLocationId.HomeGroup.
segment.target: Use FileOpenPicker to create the file picker, and then set the picker's SuggestedStartLocation to PickerLocationId.HomeGroup.

segment.source: Or, set other properties that are relevant to your users and your app.
segment.target: Or, set other properties that are relevant to your users and your app.

segment.source: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see Guidelines and checklist for file pickers
segment.target: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see Guidelines and checklist for file pickers

segment.source: This example creates a file picker that opens at the HomeGroup, includes files of any type, and displays the files as thumbnail images:
segment.target: This example creates a file picker that opens at the HomeGroup, includes files of any type, and displays the files as thumbnail images:

segment.source: Show the file picker and process the picked file.
segment.target: Show the file picker and process the picked file.

segment.source: After you create and customize the file picker, let the user pick one file by calling FileOpenPicker.PickSingleFileAsync, or multiple files by calling FileOpenPicker.PickMultipleFilesAsync.
segment.target: After you create and customize the file picker, let the user pick one file by calling FileOpenPicker.PickSingleFileAsync, or multiple files by calling FileOpenPicker.PickMultipleFilesAsync.

segment.source: This example displays the file picker to let the user pick one file:
segment.target: This example displays the file picker to let the user pick one file:

segment.source: Search the HomeGroup for files
segment.target: Search the HomeGroup for files

segment.source: This section shows how to find HomeGroup items that match a query term provided by the user.
segment.target: This section shows how to find HomeGroup items that match a query term provided by the user.

segment.source: Get the query term from the user.
segment.target: Get the query term from the user.

segment.source: Here we get a query term that the user has entered into a TextBox control called :
segment.target: Here we get a query term that the user has entered into a TextBox control called :

segment.source: Set the query options and search filter.
segment.target: Set the query options and search filter.

segment.source: Query options determine how the search results are sorted, while the search filter determines which items are included in the search results.
segment.target: Query options determine how the search results are sorted, while the search filter determines which items are included in the search results.

segment.source: This example sets query options that sort the search results by relevance and then the date modified.
segment.target: This example sets query options that sort the search results by relevance and then the date modified.

segment.source: The search filter is the query term that the user entered in the previous step:
segment.target: The search filter is the query term that the user entered in the previous step:

segment.source: Run the query and process the results.
segment.target: Run the query and process the results.

segment.source: The following example runs the search query in the HomeGroup and saves the names of any matching files as a list of strings.
segment.target: The following example runs the search query in the HomeGroup and saves the names of any matching files as a list of strings.

segment.source: Search the HomeGroup for a particular user's shared files
segment.target: Search the HomeGroup for a particular user's shared files

segment.source: This section shows you how to find HomeGroup files that are shared by a particular user.
segment.target: This section shows you how to find HomeGroup files that are shared by a particular user.

segment.source: Get a collection of HomeGroup users.
segment.target: Get a collection of HomeGroup users.

segment.source: Each of the first-level folders in the HomeGroup represents an individual HomeGroup user.
segment.target: Each of the first-level folders in the HomeGroup represents an individual HomeGroup user.

segment.source: So, to get the collection of HomeGroup users, call GetFoldersAsync retrieve the top-level HomeGroup folders.
segment.target: So, to get the collection of HomeGroup users, call GetFoldersAsync retrieve the top-level HomeGroup folders.

segment.source: Find the target user's folder, and then create a file query scoped to that user's folder.
segment.target: Find the target user's folder, and then create a file query scoped to that user's folder.

segment.source: The following example iterates through the retrieved folders to find the target user's folder.
segment.target: The following example iterates through the retrieved folders to find the target user's folder.

segment.source: Then, it sets query options to find all files in the folder, sorted first by relevance and then by the date modified.
segment.target: Then, it sets query options to find all files in the folder, sorted first by relevance and then by the date modified.

segment.source: The example builds a string that reports the number of files found, along with the names of the files.
segment.target: The example builds a string that reports the number of files found, along with the names of the files.

segment.source: Stream video from the HomeGroup
segment.target: Stream video from the HomeGroup

segment.source: Follow these steps to stream video content from the HomeGroup:
segment.target: Follow these steps to stream video content from the HomeGroup:

segment.source: Include a MediaElement in your app.
segment.target: Include a MediaElement in your app.

segment.source: A MediaElement lets you play back audio and video content in your app.
segment.target: A MediaElement lets you play back audio and video content in your app.

segment.source: For more information on audio and video playback, see Create custom transport controls and Audio, video, and camera.
segment.target: For more information on audio and video playback, see Create custom transport controls and Audio, video, and camera.

segment.source: Open a file picker at the HomeGroup and apply a filter that includes video files in the formats that your app supports.
segment.target: Open a file picker at the HomeGroup and apply a filter that includes video files in the formats that your app supports.

segment.source: This example includes .mp4 and .wmv files in the file open picker.
segment.target: This example includes .mp4 and .wmv files in the file open picker.

segment.source: Open the the user's file selection for read access, and set the file stream as the source for the MediaElement, and then play the file.
segment.target: Open the the user's file selection for read access, and set the file stream as the source for the MediaElement, and then play the file.
